author: gstein
msg: Enable propagation of exceptions from the editor callbacks "through"
the C code, and back to the Python-based caller.
* include/svn_error_codes.h (SVN_ERR_SWIG_PY_EXCEPTION_SET): new code.
states that a Python exception has been set within the Python
runtime system.
* bindings/swig/svn_types.i (svn_error_t typemap): if the error
indicates that an exception has already been set, then just return
so that Python can pick up the existing exception.
* bindings/swig/swigutil_py.c (convert_python_error): rather than
returning a "generic" error, return SVN_ERR_SWIG_PY_EXCEPTION_SET
to tell callers that a Python exception has been set; if the
ultimate caller was a Python script, then this exception will be
useful [so don't overwrite it]
(close_baton, thunk_apply_textdelta): due to some idiosyncratic
behavior in Python (probably some back-compat stuff), using a
simple "O" for method args when that object is a *tuple* means
that the call will unpack the tuple as arguments, rather than
passing the tuple as a single argument. wrapping parens around the
build-format will ensure that the tuple is placed into an argument
tuple and arrive at the target func as a single arg.
[ this was causing a problem when I switched an editor baton to a
tuple, and suddenly got errors invoking the callbacks; it was
impossible to figure out until I fixed the exception propagation
with the PY_EXCEPTION_SET changes ]
